Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Captain on the bridge!
I didn't want to miss the excitement.
Be ready to fire on my command! We'll teach those Mor--
@BATTLE
Threats have been neutralized, Captain! No sign of enemy Mor--
No!
Oh, hell.
Oh, jings, that was close. If you say their name, you give them power!
Ma'am, if we don't provide an accurate report on the Morganas...
You said it! Now we're bound to have a curse of some kind!

Fields.MenuText: Who's "we?" You didn't say it.
"Of some kind?" You don't even know what's going to happen?
Surely you don't believe that!

Fields.DialogueText: You're aboard a ship, Captain! You get cursed, it's everyone's curse!
That's what makes them scary!
That's what they said about Belles and... those other ones! And here we are.
I think we'll be okay, Edinburgh.
Gah! Don't be so sure, Captain.
Don't say it!
"Be ready to fire?"
The M-word!
... Fine. Move to engage the... enemy.
*THUD*
Oh, come on. That pipe's needed to be replaced for days.
Our bloody luck needs replaced...
Have you seen Edinburgh?
I saw her here in the mess earlier. She said something about torpedoes and curses...
Torpedoes!? This could be serious!

Fields.MenuText: Dare I ask?
What goes into one of those?
I thought our torpedoes were in trouble.

Fields.DialogueText: I recommend it! It might save your life.
Bit of this, bit of that. You drink it for the effect. The name says it all.
I'd know if they were. I'd also be drinking even more.
*ALARM*
Enemy Mor--
Don't say their name!
@BATTLE
Dinnae fash yourself, Captain. I was whipping up a torpedo cocktail.
I take it the curse is over, then.
For now, it seems so. I think that pipe was the whole of it. Once I bullied that one reckless gadge said the word into fixing it, anyway.
You made the mess, you clean it up, eh?
That's about the shape of it.
Lots of uncertainty around this curse of yours.
Wouldn't be a curse otherwise.
Should you really be drinking, then?
This little thing? Might as well be fruit juice. Belle perk. No, Captain, I was just thirsty.
If you say so.
Captain!
Mm?
I know you're busy eating, but do you have a moment?

Fields.MenuText: As long as it's quick. What do you need, Edinburgh?
This can't wait?
You seem like you're in a rush. Why don't you have a seat?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... food. I need food.
Not if I go hungry. There's an issue with the food.
I'll sit with you once I find something to eat.
What's going on?
Well... I noticed that there isn't a large selection for those with different diets...
Different diets?
I'm a vegetarian, Captain! I would love if we could expand our selection a bit - include some more vegetables, nuts and beans for protein, that sort of thing.
Sure. I'll put in a request for our next resupply.
And... maybe the ingredients to make torpedo cocktails?
You know, I don't think I ever learned what was in those.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'll get you a Christmas list before the week's out. Nothing like a bevvy to stave off a curse.
So it does keep away the Mor--
Ghk!
... Demons?
Certainly doesn't attract them. That's good enough for me.
*ALARM*
Morg--
Don't!
Enemy almost in range, Captain!
@BATTLE
Status?
Enemies neutralized, Captain.
Nice work, crew.
First round is on me!
We don't have much booze on hand, Edinburgh...
Are you sure about that, Captain? The goods I requested came in with the last supply shipment. In other words...
Torpedo cocktails for everyone!
Hurrah!
Edinburgh...
Yes... Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe hold off on that for a little while. The crew has duties they need to attend to.
A little celebration is fine. Just... don't go overboard.
Have a good time.

Fields.DialogueText: Right. Belay the hurrahs!
Can't be done, Captain! The crew have me looking after them.
Aye-aye, Captain!
There's a good hen.
I'll let Command know the Morganas are-- whoa!
Enough of that! ... Oh, crivvens, Captain, are you all right?
I'll be fine. Put me down.
Captain, sorry to bother you...
No bother. What can I do for you?
Do you have a pair of gloves?

Fields.MenuText: Come again?
Are your hands cold, Edinburgh?
Don't worry. You didn't leave any marks.

Fields.DialogueText: Gloves! I need them! Do you have a pair I can use?
No, and I plan on keeping them that way!
I said I was sorry!
Why the concern about your hands?
As you are aware, Captain, I'm heavily armed. Bit of a big yin among the Town-class lasses.
Yes, but what does that have to do with the temperature of your hands?
Well, armament considered, I need to be at my best. My hands must always be limber and ready for battle.
Not to mention for picking me up and covering my mouth.
Curse or no, Captain, I'd pulverise those little beasties a lot cleaner with a nice pair of gloves.
Well, to your earlier point, I can't risk us not being at our best. I'll see about securing some.
Thank you, Captain! Shake on it?
@BATTLE
It was for your own good, you know! You never know what might-- gah!
What the!?
Whew... Sorry, Captain. That rat was getting curious.
You're curious, Edinburgh.
*THUD*
As I was saying. You never know what might sneak in when our defenses are down.
Are you still on about the curse? It probably came aboard during the resupply.
*ALARM*
Ah, right! I'll go wash my hands, then.
Look, Edinburgh... I know the crew like it, but it really shouldn't be available to them at all times.
Oh, don't be such a worrywart! It will be fine.
Perfect! The Captain will settle this debate for us!
Captain, please, talk some sense into Edinburgh...
I have all the sense I need, thank you very much.
What's going on?
You see, Captain, I was hoping we could move the ingredients for a torpedo cocktails into the mess hall, so the crew can celebrate whenever they see fit!
And I've been doing my best to remind Edinburgh that not all of our people have the constitution of a supernatural ship spirit.
We need to look out for their best interests, and that means ensuring that they are sober enough to perform their duties.

Fields.MenuText: The crew have their alcohol rations, Edinburgh. The cocktails can wait for special occasions.
I'm of the mind the ship would be better off with no alcohol whatsoever.
The ingredients can be moved to the galley, but kept under lock and key. They'll be available, but not freely.

Fields.DialogueText: Like when curses get lifted? Seems to be common enough lately.
Captain! Have you no humanity?
Fair compromise. Wouldn't do to have them all plastered.
All right, Captain. I'll handle the rest.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
What will be fine?
Always good to have options. What to do to unwind post-battle, though...
We'll think of something when we get there.
There's many a man of the Cameron clan that has followed his chief to the field... eh?
Hmm...
The Captain's quarters are awfully spacious...

Fields.MenuText: Edinburgh? What are you doing in here?
Are you plotting something? You look as if you're plotting something.
There are some real downsides to ship spirits capable of floating through solid walls.

Fields.DialogueText: Just trying to find the perfect spot for a bath.
I am plotting something! Where to install a bath, mainly.
Downsides? Bah. I'm just looking for a place to put a bath.
A bath... in my quarters?
Not just any bath... a Turkish bath! Doesn't it sound so relaxing?
You want to elaborate on the differences between the two?
Ah, of course. A Turkish bath is also known as a sauna. So warm and relaxing and inviting... I want a special way of unwinding after a hard-fought battle!
And your quarters just happen to be the perfect size...
*ALARM*
We need to get to the bridge.
And after the battle's over, we can talk about where to build the bath!
Enough about the bath!
@BATTLE
I-I just don't get how you do it...
It takes time and practise, of course. But with enough patience, you'll be able to dance like this!
How do you move... Gah!
*THUD*
Hahaha! Oh... sorry! I didn't mean to laugh! Here, let me help you up.

Fields.MenuText: I heard a crash. What's wrong?
Trouble? Are we under attack?
Are you dancing, Edinburgh?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing! This gentleman thought he could dance at a professional level with no prior training. A quick cowp convinced him otherwise.
Not at all. Unless you consider uncoordinated dancing an attack on your senses.
Just giving a few pointers. Would you like to join in, Captain?
Thanks for the lesson, Edinburgh. It was... more difficult than I was expecting.
Practise the steps I showed you. We'll try again here in a few days. I think you'll surprise yourself!
R-right!
I didn't know you could dance.
Like a gannet on the waves! Now, how about I try to teach you some moves? I won't take no for an answer!
@BATTLE
Jury's out.
*ALARM*
Saved by the--
... Alarm.
See? You're learning too!
Captain! A moment?
Sure, what do you need?
I'm handcrafting a book cover and I need someone to hold everything in place... Would you help?
Sure.
Excellent. Thank you!

Fields.MenuText: So where did you learn how to do this?
You must really like reading.
What's this for?

Fields.DialogueText: I taught myself. I have a soft spot for books, and wanted mine to look extra special.
Of course! Have you seen my book collection?
Well, it's a book cover...
And... I think I'm done!
It looks pretty good!
I noticed some of the covers on the books in your office were fraying, so I made you this one to protect against further harm.
Oh, wow, Edinburgh. Thanks. That's really thoughtful of you.
It was my pleasure! Leatherwork simmers me right down.
@BATTLE
I don't... think so.
Look up.
Oh, wow. That is... a lot of books.
I meant which book.
Ah! Ha! Wait a moment, and I'll tell you.
*ALARM*
Got anything to protect against these... witches?
I could try to wrap myself in leather, but that's a one-way ticket to sweltering.
You sure take victories in stride, ma'am!
I'm glad we have someone else who appreciates a celebration!
May we defeat everything else that gets in our way! Cheers!
Cheers!
It really isn't fair that you're able to drink and drink, all without suffering a hangover in the morning!
One of the many perks to being a Belle! Want another?
I'll do without. I want to be capable of rolling out of bed tomorrow morning.
Hey, it's the Captain!
Captain! Care to join?

Fields.MenuText: Sure, I could use a few minutes to unwind after that last fight. Let's drink!
This isn't something I'm going to do after every battle.
No, thank you, Edinburgh. But I appreciate the offer.

Fields.DialogueText: Great! Have a seat and I'll pour you one!
Of course not. But a little celebration now and then is good for the soul!
All right, all right. You are a very disciplined captain, Captain.
Drink up, everyone! Those witches haven't killed us yet!
The sacrifices of rank.
I hate these things.
They're a real pack of weapons, aren't they? Just watch how I dance!
You know, I never thought of a battle that way.
We're both moving, aren't we? We're paying attention to each other. The only difference is that this dance has a winner!
@BATTLE
No... I think we'll have to renovate the whole room...
This is all sounding a little outlandish, Edinburgh. You're sure the captain would want this?
The captain works harder than anyone else aboard this ship. Relaxation is important! We can't have the captain feeling burnt out.
I agree! It's just that this Turkish bath idea seems a bit... unlike the captain...
Imagine it... soothing, warm steam... a veritable paradise...

Fields.MenuText: Ahem.
You know... it's impolite to let yourself into someone's quarters without their permission.
What's the meaning of this?

Fields.DialogueText: Eek! Captain! You're... here!
Aah! C-Captain! Of course, my apologies!
Captain! Aaa! Nothing, nothing. Nothing serious, at least!
We'll, uh... talk later, all right?
Okay...
No, you won't. You're not turning my quarters into a Turkish bathhouse. End of discussion. Now please, leave. I have work to do.
If you think you can dunt me off the road to a glorious steam bath, think again!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I'd worry more about getting... dunted... by the Mo--
You did that on purpose.
Afraid not, Captain. Why use a false alarm when I can shut you up with my hands?
You make a fair point.
My cold, gloveless hands...
They're on my to-do list!
You've never read any of his work before?
What with the war and everything, I haven't had time.
There's time now! Maybe we could start a little book club!
A book club?
We have to make time for a few pleasures now and then - otherwise, we'll all go crazy! Reading a good book might be just the ticket.
Taking a break?
Nae danger, Captain! You caught me plotting again.

Fields.MenuText: I've said it hundreds of times, Edinburgh. No bathhouse.
I trust it's nothing that involves me?
About what?

Fields.DialogueText: Not that! We're putting together a little club, the crew and I.
Only if you want, Captain! I'd like to start a book club!
A book club!
A club?
She thinks it might help some of us relax.
Excuse me, Captain! Enemies inbound!
Acknowledged. You've really got them trained.
All in how you make your case, Captain. A right jaggy jab processes the word right out of your lexicon. Especially with a cocktail to replace it.
@BATTLE
So, about this club you were discussing...?
That's right! You're interested, aren't you? Maybe you can help me pare down from this selection.
*THUD*
You carry around that many books with you?
Of course I do! My book collection is gigantic. Why do you think I have such impressive upper body strength?
Belle perk?
Even William Wallace's sword needed sharpened. Now, I have books by Robert Lewis Stevenson, Sir Walter Scott, David Hume...
Am I William Wallace in this analogy?
Oh, haud yer wheesht about Wallace. It just so happens that one of the French girls started her own book club...

Fields.MenuText: You've got competition.
Which one?
Reading a little Flaubert?

Fields.DialogueText: I've got collaboration! Maybe.
I can never pronounce her name. That one fancy lass that dresses all Indochina.
Someone American, actually. Not that there's anything wrong with that.
It's no surprise one of the other Belles is trying this. We're a fairly cultured bunch.
Superstitions and all.
Oi! That counts as culture!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Right, sorry.
Anyway. If it's worth doing, it's worth doing together. I'll just give her a ring and see if she'd like to expand her circle.
Then I'd be happy to help curate some suggestions.
Oh, isn't this exciting? The Auld Alliance lives on!
If anything's bringing the world together, it's you Belles.
Don't sell yourself short. You built us this way!
Zzzzz...
Captain!
Gah! Are we under attack?
Presently. Thought you'd appreciate a wake-up from me, rather than from the alarm.
I'll be right to the bridge. Those Morganas won't--
@BATTLE
Captain, surely you agree that we should appreciate every calm moment we can.
I can agree with that... but that doesn't explain what you're doing in my quarters.
Warding it against your favourite curse.
By hanging popcorn garlands and setting out a keg of... what I can only assume is your torpedo concoction.
Bubble, bubble, toil and trouble!

Fields.MenuText: It's been a long day. You sure you wouldn't rather... I don't know. Play cards?
You know... why not? We are still alive, after all!

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe once I get the crew good and drunk. Easier to read them that way.
That's the spirit!
I still don't see how this is going to counteract my saying the M-word. Or even that it needs to. We did fine in that battle.
That's the nature of a curse. It'll get you when you least expect it.
My advice? Don't. Throw back a cocktail, or water if that's more your speed. You defy a curse with happiness instead of letting it rule your life.
Oh, git tae-- ugh. Captain, if we trip over a whale I'm blaming you.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not really in a drinking mood.

Fields.DialogueText: That's all right, Captain. I've got plenty of fruit juice without the bite.
Except for the part where you can't say certain words.
Same reason we check me for leaks in port. No sense letting the sea in just because you can deal with it.
Right. "We."
Now, talking of dealing with it, help me--
*THUD*
Set this keg straight. Jings, we're lucky it didn't crack.
Do you have a minute, Captain?
Sure, what's on your mind?
It's about the book club! One of the officers said we're about to start our resupply at sea, and I'm going to use the time to send books to a few Belles.
That's great! So... what's the issue, then?
I've fairly narrowed it down. I just need help choosing the first one.
What do you have for choices?
I'm thinking an essay by David Hume... it's a good conversation piece! But then, Ivanhoe's also a possibility - such a passionate story!

Fields.MenuText: I think you should start off with a nice and simple story.
An essay is a bit obtuse... but I think it's a great way to share an opinion.
How about your favorite book?

Fields.DialogueText: Perfect! I was thinking Ivanhoe, too!
Hopefully it opens up conversation! And once we've finished the essay, we can move onto fiction.
Hmmm... Treasure Island would be a good pick. I'll do it!
I just hope they like it.
I'm sure they will. Even if they don't, it's fun to talk about why that is.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
You're right! What's a literary fistfight between friends?
I don't think I'm familiar with the concept.
Everyone's got a story they'll defend to the death. Half the fun is in finding it.
Captain, we have an issue.
What about?
Well, the crew have adapted pretty well to the new normal. But some of us just can't shake the feeling that all this is a bit silly.
I'm not sure I follow.
It's Edinburgh and her superstitions.
Her superstitions?
Please, tell her there's no bad luck involved with saying the word "Morgana". It would make our lives so much easier.

Fields.MenuText: Is that all? The crew have been forbidden from saying the word "Morgana" since Edinburgh awoke, and we're all still alive and well.
Is it really that big of a deal?
All right, all right. I'll talk to her.

Fields.DialogueText: For now... please, Captain. Consider what I've said.
It could be, Captain. Little slips are inevitable.
Thank you, Captain. Even if it doesn't work.
Thanks for bringing it to my attention.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Problems, Captain? She looks like she's proper feart of something.
Just pre-battle jitters. It happens to us all.
That'd explain the torpedo our crew just fumbled. Lucky I was around to catch it, or that would have been an awful misfortune.
Misfortune. Right.
Edinburgh?
Sleeping again?
O-Oh! Captain! I apologize! No, not sleeping. Just caught up in my reading, that's all.
What were you reading?
The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde! I can hardly put it down.

Fields.MenuText: I've never read it. Make that the next book for your club, yeah?
You hear back from any of the Belles?

Fields.DialogueText: It's on the list! I'm almost done if you don't want to wait. You'll blow through it in an afternoon.
A few! And not just the French and Brits, either. One of the Soviets has been going on and on about this one pirate story.
I'm glad our membership's so far-flung, to tell the truth. It gives us all time to think.
Got to be prepared to go to bat for your favourites.
Literature isn't a competition, Captain! It's an exchange. I appreciate being told I'm wrong now and again.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: One of my favourites! I've never met someone who didn't like it.

Fields.DialogueText: Neither have I, but I'm excited for the day that I do.
*ALARM*
It's the disagreements that make life interesting, isn't it?
There's some absolute belters. That one Frenchy went on for ten pages about Steinbeck...
We need to talk, Edinburgh.
Sure! What about?
Well, a few of the officers have approached me...
Look, I'm no longer planning on turning the mess hall into a bathhouse, so they can quit their worrying.

Fields.MenuText: You were planning on doing what?
No, no. We need to talk about your superstitions.
Why won't you say our enemy's name?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I figured your quarters were off limits... Never mind! What's the problem?
Broad question, Captain. I could keep you here with it all day - not that I'd be opposed, mind.
Haven't you noticed all the trouble it causes?
It's just that some of the officers think that your policy hampers the crew's communication.
They've come up with alternatives, haven't they? Witches, weapons, beasties, boots...
How about not interrupting the crew when they try to relay information.
I understand, Captain. I'd just rather avoid trouble where we can.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Trouble is our job. If we can pick the type we face, I'd rather err on the side of efficiency and deal with whatever else comes our way.
Perhaps with a torpedo cocktail to take the edge off?
Whatever works. And leave the paperwork alone. If I see one more communiqué with six letters blacked out of a certain seven-letter word...
Find some treasure?
Just having a little chat with Giles. I haven't shown you this pendant, have I?
The saint?

Fields.MenuText: I can't wrap my head around Belles praying to humans. Shouldn't it be the other way around?
Does he protect against curses?
I hope I didn't interrupt.

Fields.DialogueText: Leave that for after I'm gone. You're you and I'm me, but there's something greater hidden in every person.
If we don't go looking for them.
He'll still be there when I come back.
He's quite the busy man, is Saint Giles. Scots talk to him about poverty, fits... and a whole barrel of superstitions.
Oh! And he was a vegetarian too.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
The very same! Even spirits talk to spirits now and again.
Do you ever get tempted to join us when there's really good meat in the galley?
Never tried it! But I'm all right going without. Plenty of ways to go about one's business.
And to scare off the odd Morg--
... Go on.
Sorry, Edinburgh. I'm trying to be better about catching myself.
Which I appreciate. But it's nothing we can't handle. We deal with the real thing well enough, don't we?
I hope it's not too much trouble to ask.
They're her books. Why don't you ask Edinburgh yourself?
Belles are hard to find when they get up to something. She could be anywhere.
After a battle, she typically heads to the mess hall.
That's the first place I looked. I could have sworn I saw her walk into your quarters.
Well, her books are scattered all around... again.
I'm here, I'm here! Behind the pile of books!

Fields.MenuText: Doing what?
Were you sleeping back there?
Why are all of these books in my quarters, Edinburgh?

Fields.DialogueText: Bit of research. I got caught up.
Just a quick kip. I've been so busy lately writing back and forth about the book club.
Ran out of room in my own cabin. I'll clear it with you next time.
Well, now that you're here... can I borrow a book?
Sure! Which one? I have hundreds... perhaps thousands. Haven't really bothered to count.
How do you have time to read all these?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
The longer the war, the more I'll have!
That was a joke.
Hopefully.
Come to think of it, I hadn't decided which one I wanted to give you...
What's that?
Nothing! Forget I said anything.
Any progress on the gloves front, Captain?
Working on it. I figured I should get a tailor back home to work on them. These things take time.
No rush! I know you're as good as your word.

Fields.MenuText: I should have asked... is there a material you prefer?

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever's warm and comfortable. Any captain I pick can be trusted with that decision!
Do things like that really affect your performance in battle?
Every Belle has a different answer.
I definitely know people who do. That, or annoyances that trip them up.
Like when people say... you know.
I know.
I'm sure there's a reasonable explanation for why these strange accidents have been happening. But the minute we leave coincidence to itself... well, I'd rather not.
You know, I think I remember reading about Saint Giles in your dossier. Didn't he take an arrow meant for a deer?
That's why he's patron saint of the crippled and wounded.
I'll keep away from the M-word. But if anyone can take an arrow for the innocent, it's you. No matter what comes our way.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised your hands get so cold. You're a warm sort of person.
Even if the word is cursed?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, crivvens, don't make me blush. It steals the heat right from my hands!
You won't catch me saying it! But I appreciate you trying to catch yourself.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I think like any superstition, there's a bit of truth that the story springs up around. Don't you have any little rituals that keep you going?
Shame our enemy's caught up to our technology, isn't it?
Just the time we were born into. Our mission is the same!
Thank you, Captain. You're a real chum.
Captain! Another Belle wants to join the book club!
Really? That's great.
I wasn't sure how far this would spread, but it really seems to be catching on!
We all need pleasant distractions from time to time.
I wouldn't call them distractions. Isn't this war the real distraction?

Fields.MenuText: It's the most important thing happening in our lives right now.
That Turkish bath idea ranks a little higher.
I'd certainly like to get back to my life.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, we didn't start it.
Ooh, I knew it'd stick in your mind!
You never left it, Captain. None of us did.
You humans are hoora good at war, Captain. And we Belles are built for it.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
But you know what I'd rather be doing? Lighting a nice, tall candle and putting my feet up with some Hume.
Whatever time we can scrape back from those nautical nasties is ours to do with as we please.
I'm glad you're here to remind us of that.
That's the real anti-curse. A bit of happiness reminds us of what we're really fighting for.
However I can! Just wait until I get you your-- ghk!
My what?
Nothing! You heard nothing!
I got another letter!
From whom?
An Italian Belle. She loved the book you helped recommend.
That's quite the list of participating Belles, Edinburgh. Do you need any help?
Help?

Fields.MenuText: I could put together a system that would keep the club more organized.
There are a few crew members whom I could assign to assist you. I'm sure they wouldn't mind - they're all readers.
I could think of the next book!

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I'd love that!
Actually, that would be very helpful!
We're not quite to that point yet, but I'll be sure to let you know when we are!
What you said about carrying on during this war is true. I'll support it however I can.
I appreciate your help so much, Captain. It means a lot to me.
*ALARM*
Now you sound a little like Bulldog.
Ha! Now there's one who could stand to loosen her grip a bit.
@BATTLE
Although I suppose could step it down a notch and let the French lass handle it. Once I get on to an idea it's an age before I let go.
Captain?
Is this about Edinburgh again?
How did you know?
That's all you talk to me about. What's the issue?
It isn't an issue, but a solution to a problem.
Solution?
Edinburgh is still talking about that bathhouse.

Fields.MenuText: Not you, too... We are not building a bathhouse!
Look, can you cut to the chase?
I'm getting tired of all this bath talk.

Fields.DialogueText: You can say no all you want, Captain, but Edinburgh... she is not the easily-deterred type.
Sorry, Captain!
Me, too, Captain. Though I would kind of like to sweat it out.
I think if we were just to build one and get it over with...
Just... bring me some plans. This isn't me saying yes - it's just me saying I'm willing to consider it.
Thank you, Captain.
And, Officer?
Yes?
Don't tell Edinburgh.
@BATTLE
So I've been told.
*ALARM*
Don't tell me what?
Isn't there something you've been pointedly avoiding saying until the proper time?
Pure right, Captain. I'll hold my tongue.
They're almost in range, Captain.
How would you feel about pouring on a little more speed?
... Any particular reason?
I'd really like to start shooting at them before they can try to talk to us.
@BATTLE
It's time!
Time for what?
To celebrate!
Celebrate? You celebrate after every battle. What's so different about this one?
Oh, stop your haverin'! I see that package behind your back.
Couldn't wait, Captain! And speaking of leather...
Well, rexine. I figured, you being a vegetarian and all...
I won't eat an animal. But someone will. No sense letting the rest of the beastie go to waste.
What's that?
I'm going to teach you to dance! And not just any dance - highland dancing!

Fields.MenuText: Life with you is an adventure, Edinburgh.
Why not? The more the merrier.

Fields.DialogueText: You were meant to. I suppose this has something to do with the leatherbound copy of Treasure Island I found in my quarters.
But I appreciate the consideration!
Ooh! Not to mention the feel. They're so soft... and they trap the heat like... well, like a trap. Oh, thank you, Captain!
You know, that reminds me. I had one more gift for you.
Let me see those moves, Captain! We've got a lot of dances ahead of us.
Well, I for one am excited to see where it leads. And speaking of leading...
